intro: Rhamnus cadevallii, commonly known as the Canary Island buckthorn, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its dense, thorny foliage and small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by small, black berries that are a food source for various birds and insects. It thrives in coastal and dry environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in arid landscapes.
